2 | Cambridgeshire County Council – Adult Social Care Survey 2024  results  - Easy Read 
 Pictures  Words  
 In 202 4 Cambridgeshire County Council  sent their 
Adult Social Care  survey to 159 7 people . 
 
These are people who use Adult Social Care services.  
 Some of these people have care in their own home. 
Some live in residential care and some have nursing 
care. 
 Some of these people need help with their personal 
care or their mental health.  
 Others  have a learning or physical disability . 
 3 out of 10 people  sent their survey back to us.  
 
 
The results of their answers can be found below.

[Page 1]
Adult Social Care Forum shared 
priorities action plan 2022 -23 
final report
Adult Social Care Forum 
27 April 2023


[Page 2 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
The Adult Social Care Forum
•The Adult Social Care Forum  is a group that talks about 
health and social care issues in Cambridgeshire and 
Peterborough.
•The Forum looks at key themes raised by the Partnership 
Boards and expert by experience groups and uses this 
information to help make local services better.
•The Forum agrees actions to help this to happen.
•The Forum is chaired by the Head of Commissioning (Adult 
Social Care), CCC/PCC and has members from:
oThe five Adult Social Care Partnership Boards
oSUN Network
oCounting Every Adult co -production group
oHealthwatch Cambridgeshire and Peterborough
oCambridgeshire County Council and Peterborough City Council
oHealth organisations

retrieved_documents.content:
[Page 1]
 
1 | Cambridgeshire County Council – Assessment and eligibility  | July 2024  
  
  
Assessment and Eligibility for Adult 
Social Care services  
Many people are able to stay independent, safe,  and well without 
needing support from Adult Social Care. We recommend that you 
explore options such as equipment and technology and community help, first. 
You can find out lots of information on the council’s website at www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk/residents/adults/organising- care- and-
support  
 
 
If you have tried other ways to stay independent and still need further 
support, the first step is to contact the council for a conversation.  
Contact details are at the end of this information sheet.  
 
We may suggest that you have a S ocial Care Assessment. This 
assessment looks at your strengths and your needs and identifies what 
support you may require . 
This includes giving information and advice to help you remain 
independent for as long as possible, and care and support for those

retrieved_documents.expanded_query: what is the current adult social care allocation for adult social care in cambridgeshire?

retrieved_documents.content:
[Page 6 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
6 www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk Spend in Cambridgeshire 
County Council 
on Adult Social Care 2023/24 
Annual expenditure across all services for 9,372 people for 2023/2024 was £258,000,000.00 
which can be seen in the following data which represents number of people and annual 
expenditure for each service area (figures are total numbers throughout the year). For the 
authority’s statutory returns, supported living beds are included in the data for community-
based services. The actual number of people in learning disability supported living services, 
(as opposed to residential) as of November 2024 is 621, at an annual cost of £55,165,546: 
Service Number of 
People Annual 
Expenditure 
Older People & Physical Disabilities Accommodation based 2177 £69m 
Older People & Physical Disabilities Community based 3473 £41m 
Physical Disabilities under 65 age Accommodation based 70 £3m 
Physical Disabilities under 65 age Community based 726 £10m

• Development of a more localised, place-based offer 
• Supporting community resilience and micro-enterprises 
• Enabling positive risk-taking to empower adults we support to have healthy 
relationships and fulfilling lives 
• Workforce recruitment and retention 
• Supporting people to remain as independent as possible for as long as possible 
• Supporting carers 
• Greater integration of services across public and third sector organisations 
This Market Position Statement part of an ongoing conversation and we would 
welcome any thoughts and ideas you have about the future of adult social care in 
Cambridgeshire. If you would like to know more, or speak to us, please contact: 
accommodation.team@cambridgeshire.gov.uk

7.1.6  It should be noted that , as with all local authorities, Cambridgeshire  County 
Council  is in a n extremely difficult financial situation with  significant  savings to 
find to deliver a balanced budget in 2023/24. The Council has many statutory 
services to deliver , which are all subject to inc reasing costs , of which adult 
social care is but one. Therefore, whatever our aspirations for improving 
funding levels in the adult social care market, unless funding from central

[Page 4 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
 
4 | Cambridgeshire County Council – Planning your Care and Support | July 2024 
 What happens to the plan?  
The care and support plan belongs to you. A social care worker will need 
to see it to check that it has all the information it needs. The information we collect is recorded on paper, in databases and in electronic folders 
on the council’s secure network where it is accessible only to staff who 
need to see it to do their jobs. This might include staff in external organisations such as the NHS and the Care Quality Commission. Some 
of the information in our databases can be accessed remotely on mobile 
devices,  by staff who visit you in your home.  
 You can find out more about how we keep your information safe in our 
Information Sheet Your Social Care Records and Your Rights . 
 
Reviewing your support  
We will usually review your support  within 12 weeks of a care and 
support plan being implemented and annually thereafter. You can invite

answer:
The current budget allocation for Adult Social Care in Cambridgeshire for the year 2023/2024 is **£258 million**. This budget covers services for 9,372 people across various service areas.

- **Older People & Physical Disabilities Accommodation-based services**: £69 million for 2,177 people.
- **Older People & Physical Disabilities Community-based services**: £41 million for 3,473 people.
- **Physical Disabilities under 65 Accommodation-based services**: £3 million for 70 people.
- **Physical Disabilities under 65 Community-based services**: £10 million for 726 people.

For more detailed information, you can visit the Cambridgeshire County Council's website at [www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk](https://www.cambridgeshire.gov.uk) or contact the Adult Social Care department directly through their provided contact details.

test_metadata.prompt_template:
Please answer the following question about social care services in UK local authorities based only on the information in the provided documents.

Question: {query}

Context from relevant documents:
{context}

Instructions:
1. Provide a clear, direct answer that would help someone needing this information. If information isn't available, state: "The available documents don't provide specific information about [aspect]."

2. Synthesize information from ALL relevant documents to provide the most complete answer rather than analyzing documents individually.

3. Structure your response with:
   - A concise 1-2 sentence summary first
   - Relevant details organized in short, clear paragraphs
   - Bullet points for lists or step-by-step information
   - Bold text for key information the user should notice

4. For financial information:
   - Include exact figures, time periods, and what the funding covers
   - Present financial data clearly: "The adult social care budget is **£X million** for [time period]"

5. Always include practical next steps or resources:
   - Provide contact information, URLs, or application methods mentioned in the documents
   - Suggest where the person could find more information

6. When citing sources, use a simple format: "According to [document name/description]" or include URLs where available.

Answer:
